ColumnInfo.Name: Offset In Minutes From Greenwich Time

DisplayString.Name: Inside Technologies - Veeam Endpoint Unofficial
DisplayString.Description: This custom management pack allows you to keep under control your client/server with Veeam Endpoint installed.

DisplayString.Name: Populate Veeam Endpoint Group
DisplayString.Description: This discovery rule populates the group 'Veeam Endpoint Group'

DisplayString.Name: Service Running State
DisplayString.Description: Monitors the current status of the Windows service. An alert from this monitor indicates the Windows Service is not currently running

DisplayString.Name: Windows Service Stopped
DisplayString.Description: The '{0}' service on computer {1} has stopped running

DisplayString.Name: Windows Service CPU Usage Monitor
DisplayString.Description: Monitors the CPU Usage of the Windows service.

DisplayString.Name: CPU Usage threshold exceeded
DisplayString.Description: The '{0}' service has exceeded the % Processor Time threshold with a value of {1}.

DisplayString.Name: Windows Service Memory Usage Monitor
DisplayString.Description: Monitors the memory usage of the Windows service.

DisplayString.Name: Memory usage threshold exceeded
DisplayString.Description: The '{0}' service has exceeded the memory usage threshold with a value of {1}.

section.maml:title: Summary
section.maml:para: This monitor monitors the Memory usage of a Windows service by querying WMI for the performance counter on a timed interval. The monitor is a consecutive samples over threshold monitor. This means that the monitor will alert if the memory usage exceeds the given threshold for the given number of consecutive samples. The specific kind of memory usage being monitored is Private Bytes.

section.maml:title: Summary
section.maml:para: This monitor monitors the CPU Usage of a Windows service by querying WMI for the performance counter on a timed interval. The monitor is a consecutive samples over threshold monitor. This means that the monitor will alert if the CPU usage exceeds the given threshold for the given number of consecutive samples.

section.maml:title: Summary
section.maml:para: This monitor checks the status of a Windows service by querying the service control manager on a timed interval. The monitor can be configured in two ways.

1) If the monitor is configured to monitor only automatic services. In this case, if the service is set to automatically start and the service is not currently running an alert will be raised. If the service is set to manually start or it is disabled, no alert will be raised when the service is stopped.

2) If the monitor is not configured to monitor only automatic services. In this case, no matter how the service is configured to start, if the service is not currently running an alert will be raised.

section.maml:title: Causes
section.maml:para: A service can stop for many reasons, including:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The service was stopped by an administrator.
The service was prevented from starting because the user account could not be authenticated.
The service encountered an exception that stopped the service.
The service was improperly configured, which prevented it from starting.
Another service that this service is dependent on was stopped

section.maml:title: Resolutions
section.maml:para: You can view all collected events for this service using the following link:
